dt: {bc}a sudden spontaneous inclination or incitement to some usually unpremeditated action
{bc}a propensity or natural tendency usually other than rational
{bc}a wave of excitation transmitted through tissues and especially nerve fibers and muscles that results in physiological activity or inhibition {dx}see {dxt|nerve impulse||}{/dx}
{bc}the act of driving onward with sudden force {bc}{sx|impulsion||}
{bc}the product of the average value of a force and the time during which it acts {bc}the change in momentum produced by the force
{bc}a force so communicated as to produce motion suddenly

pt: {sc}motive{/sc} {sc}impulse{/sc} {sc}incentive{/sc} {sc}inducement{/sc} {sc}spur{/sc} {sc}goad{/sc} mean a stimulus to action. {sc}motive{/sc} implies an emotion or desire operating on the will and causing it to act.
{sc}impulse{/sc} suggests a driving power arising from personal temperament or constitution.
{sc}incentive{/sc} applies to an external influence (such as an expected reward) inciting to action.

pt.t: a bonus was offered as an {it}incentive{/it}

pt: {sc}inducement{/sc} suggests a motive prompted by the deliberate enticements or allurements of another.

pt.t: offered a watch as an {it}inducement{/it} to subscribe

pt: {sc}spur{/sc} applies to a motive that stimulates the faculties or increases energy or ardor.
{sc}goad{/sc} suggests a motive that keeps one going against one's will or desire.

pt.t: thought insecurity a {it}goad{/it} to worker efficiency

shortdef: a sudden spontaneous inclination or incitement to some usually unpremeditated action
a propensity or natural tendency usually other than rational
a wave of excitation transmitted through tissues and especially nerve fibers and muscles that results in physiological activity or inhibition

dt: {bc}the progressive physicochemical change in the membrane of a nerve fiber that follows stimulation and serves to transmit a record of sensation from a receptor or an instruction to act to an effector

shortdef: the progressive physicochemical change in the membrane of a nerve fiber that follows stimulation and serves to transmit a record of sensation from a receptor or an instruction to act to an effector —called also nervous impulse

dt: {bc}the thrust produced per unit rate of consumption of the propellant that is usually expressed in pounds of thrust per pound of propellant used per second and that is a measure of the efficiency of a rocket engine

shortdef: the thrust produced per unit rate of consumption of the propellant that is usually expressed in pounds of thrust per pound of propellant used per second and that is a measure of the efficiency of a rocket engine
